page.title: 14GHOSTS
page.content: {ANNE BOLEYN'S GHOST. } area of Lady Lane is that the 'Lady' is in fact Anne Boleyn, 2nd wife of Henry VIII, who was in fact beheded. (The story of the beheading and its reasons could have become distorted by time). It is believed that at one time Anne lived to the North East of our square near Thorns Green and could have used the lane to visit houses in the area e.g. Bollin House. It is interesting that on early maps the area to the east of Mobberley was known as 'Le Bolyn'. Thus giving some credance to the family name of Boleyn despite the spelling difference. The fact that a 'Lady' appears so often in varying stories and there is a Lady Lane suggests the sightings have been numerous and have been taking place over a long period of time.
